options.name: title
options.desciption: Document title

options.name: author
options.desciption: Author or authors of the document

options.name: date
options.desciption: Document date

options.name: lang
options.desciption:
Identifies the main language of the document using IETF language tags 
(following the [BCP 47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/bcp47) standard), 
such as `en` or `en-GB`. The [Language subtag lookup](https://r12a.github.io/app-subtags/) 
tool can look up or verify these tags. 

This affects most formats, and controls hyphenation 
in PDF output when using LaTeX (through [`babel`](https://ctan.org/pkg/babel) 
and [`polyglossia`](https://ctan.org/pkg/polyglossia)) or ConTeXt.

options.name: dir
options.desciption:
The base script direction for the document.

For bidirectional documents, native pandoc `span`s and
`div`s with the `dir` attribute (value `rtl` or `ltr`) can
be used to override the base direction in some output
formats.  This may not always be necessary if the final
renderer (e.g. the browser, when generating HTML) supports
the [Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm].

When using LaTeX for bidirectional documents, only the
`xelatex` engine is fully supported (use
`--pdf-engine=xelatex`).

options.name: number-sections
options.desciption:
Number section headings rendered ouptut. By default, sections are not numbered.
Sections with class `.unnumbered` will never be numbered, even if `number-sections`
is specified.

options.name: number-offset
options.desciption:
Offset for section headings in output (offsets are 0 by default)
The first number is added to the section number for
top-level headings, the second for second-level headings, and so on.
So, for example, if you want the first top-level heading in your
document to be numbered "6", specify `number-offset: 5`. If your
document starts with a level-2 heading which you want to be numbered
"1.5", specify `number-offset: [1,4]`. Implies `number-sections`

options.name: shift-heading-level-by
options.desciption:
Shift heading levels by a positive or negative integer.
For example, with `shift-heading-level-by: -1`, level 2
headings become level 1 headings, and level 3 headings
become level 2 headings.  Headings cannot have a level
less than 1, so a heading that would be shifted below level 1
becomes a regular paragraph.  Exception: with a shift of -N,
a level-N heading at the beginning of the document
replaces the metadata title.

options.name: cap-location
options.desciption: Where to place figure and table captions.

options.name: fig-cap-location
options.desciption: Where to place figure captions.

options.name: tbl-cap-location
options.desciption: Where to place table captions.

options.name: code-tools
options.desciption:
Include a code tools menu (for hiding and showing code).
Use `true` or `false` to enable or disable the standard code 
tools menu. Specify sub-properties `source`, `toggle`, and
`caption` to customize the behavior and appearnce of code tools.

options.name: highlight-style
options.desciption:
Specifies the coloring style to be used in highlighted source code.

Instead of a *STYLE* name, a JSON file with extension
` .theme` may be supplied.  This will be parsed as a KDE
syntax highlighting theme and (if valid) used as the
highlighting style.

options.name: syntax-definitions
options.desciption: KDE language syntax definition files (XML)

options.name: indented-code-classes
options.desciption: Specify classes to use for all indented code blocks

options.name: code-line-numbers
options.desciption: Include line numbers in code block output.

options.name: engine
options.desciption: Engine used for executable code blocks.

options.name: jupyter
options.desciption: Configures the Jupyter engine.

options.name: knitr
options.desciption: Set Knitr options.

options.name: cache
options.desciption:
Cache results of computations (using the [knitr cache](https://yihui.org/knitr/demo/cache/) 
for R documents, and [Jupyter Cache](https://jupyter-cache.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) 
for Jupyter documents).

Note that cache invalidation is triggered by changes in chunk source code 
(or other cache attributes you've defined). Use `refresh` to force a refresh
of the cache even if has not been otherwise invalidated.

options.name: freeze
options.desciption:
Option to denote that computational documents should never be re-rendered during
a global project render (`freeze: true`), or alternatively only be re-rendered
when their source file changes (`freeze: auto`).

options.name: server
options.desciption: Document server

options.name: daemon
options.desciption:
Run Jupyter kernels within a peristent daemon (to mitigate kernel startup time).
By default a daemon with a timeout of 300 seconds will be used. Set `daemon`
to another timeout value or to `false` to disable it altogether.

options.name: debug
options.desciption: Show code-execution related debug information.

options.name: eval
options.desciption: Evaluate code cells (if `false` just echos the code into output).

options.name: echo
options.desciption: Include cell source code in rendered output.

options.name: output
options.desciption: Include the results of executing the code in the output (specify `asis` to treat output as raw markdown with no enclosing containers).

options.name: warning
options.desciption: Including warnings in rendered output.

options.name: error
options.desciption:
Include errors in the output (note that this implies that errors executing code
will not halt processing of the document).

options.name: include
options.desciption: Catch all for preventing any output (code or results) from being included in output.

options.name: fig-width
options.desciption: Default width for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-height
options.desciption: Default height for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-format
options.desciption: Default format for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-dpi
options.desciption: Default DPI for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

options.name: fig-responsive
options.desciption: Whether to make images in this document responsive.

options.name: bibliography
options.desciption: Document bibliography (BibTeX or CSL). May be a single file or a list of files

options.name: csl
options.desciption: Citation Style Language file to use for formatting references.

options.name: citeproc
options.desciption:
Turn on built-in citation processing. To use this feature, you will need
to have a document containing citations and a source of bibliographic data: 
either an external bibliography file or a list of `references` in the 
document's YAML metadata. You can optionally also include a `csl` 
citation style file.

options.name: citation-abbreviations
header-includes
options.desciption: The markdown to include at the end of the document header.

options.name: include-before
options.desciption: The markdown to include at the beginning of the document body (e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command in LaTeX).

options.name: include-after
options.desciption: The markdown to include at the end of the document body (before the `</body>` tag in HTML, or the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX).

options.name: include-before-body
options.desciption:
Include contents of files, verbatim, at the beginning of the document body
(e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command 
in LaTeX).

options.name: include-after-body
options.desciption:
Include contents of files, verbatim, at the end of the document body (before
the `</body>` tag in HTML, or the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX).

options.name: include-in-header
options.desciption:
Include contents of files, verbatim, at the end of the header. This can
be used, for example, to include special CSS or JavaScript in HTML 
documents.

options.name: metadata-files
options.desciption:
Read metadata from the supplied YAML (or JSON) files. This
option can be used with every input format, but string scalars
in the YAML file will always be parsed as Markdown. Generally,
the input will be handled the same as in YAML metadata blocks.
Values in files specified later in the list will be preferred
over those specified earlier. Metadata values specified inside 
the document, or by using `-M`, overwrite values specified with
this option.

options.name: from
options.desciption: Format to read from. Extensions can be individually enabled or disabled by appending +EXTENSION or -EXTENSION to the format name (e.g. markdown+emoji).

options.name: output-file
options.desciption: Output file to write to

options.name: output-ext
options.desciption: Extension to use for generated output file

options.name: template
options.desciption: Use the specified file as a custom template for the generated document.

options.name: standalone
options.desciption: Produce output with an appropriate header and footer (e.g. a standalone HTML, LaTeX, TEI, or RTF file, not a fragment)

options.name: filters
options.desciption:
Specify executables or Lua scripts to be used as a filter transforming
the pandoc AST after the input is parsed and before the output is written.

options.name: keep-md
options.desciption: Keep the markdown file generated by executing code

options.name: keep-ipynb
options.desciption: Keep the notebook file generated from executing code.

options.name: extract-media
options.desciption:
Extract images and other media contained in or linked from the source document to the
path DIR, creating it if necessary, and adjust the images references in the document
so they point to the extracted files. Media are downloaded, read from the file
system, or extracted from a binary container (e.g. docx), as needed. The original
file paths are used if they are relative paths not containing ... Otherwise filenames
are constructed from the SHA1 hash of the contents.

options.name: resource-path
options.desciption:
List of paths to search for images and other resources. The paths should
be separated by : on Linux, UNIX, and macOS systems, and by ; on Windows.

options.name: default-image-extension
options.desciption:
Specify a default extension to use when image paths/URLs have no
extension.  This allows you to use the same source for formats that
require different kinds of images.  Currently this option only affects
the Markdown and LaTeX readers.

options.name: abbreviations
options.desciption:
Specifies a custom abbreviations file, with abbreviations one to a line.
This list is used when reading Markdown input: strings found in this list
will be followed by a nonbreaking space, and the period will not produce sentence-ending space in formats like LaTeX.  The strings may not contain
spaces.

options.name: dpi
options.desciption:
Specify the default dpi (dots per inch) value for conversion from pixels to inch/
centimeters and vice versa. (Technically, the correct term would be ppi: pixels per
inch.) The default is `96`. When images contain information about dpi internally, the
encoded value is used instead of the default specified by this option.

options.name: tab-stop
options.desciption:
Specify the number of spaces per tab (default is 4). Note that tabs
within normal textual input are always converted to spaces. Tabs 
within code are also converted, however this can be disabled with
`preserve-tabs: false`.

options.name: preserve-tabs
options.desciption:
Preserve tabs within code instead of converting them to spaces.
(By default, pandoc converts tabs to spaces before parsing its input.) 
Note that this will only affect tabs in literal code spans and code blocks. 
Tabs in regular text are always treated as spaces.

options.name: eol
options.desciption:
Manually specify line endings: `crlf` (Windows), `lf`
(macOS/Linux/UNIX), or `native` (line endings appropriate
to the OS on which pandoc is being run).  The default is
`native`.

options.name: ascii
options.desciption:
Use only ASCII characters in output. Currently supported for XML
and HTML formats (which use entities instead of UTF-8 when this
option is selected), CommonMark, gfm, and Markdown (which use
entities), roff ms (which use hexadecimal escapes), and to a
limited degree LaTeX (which uses standard commands for accented
characters when possible). roff man output uses ASCII by default.

options.name: trace
options.desciption: Display trace debug output.

options.name: fail-if-warnings
options.desciption: Exit with error status if there are any warnings.
